maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new ASCOM Camera driver object
The New-Camera cmdlet returns an ASCOM Camera driver as defined by the DeviceId parameter. The DriverId string is the internal driver identifier as returned by the ASCOM Chooser dialog.
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
Returns an ASCOM Camera driver object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new camera simulator and assigns it to the $cam variable

PS C:\> $id = Show-Chooser "Camera" PS C:\> $cam = New-Camera $id PS C:\> $cam
BinX : BinY : CCDTemperature : 0 CameraState : cameraIdle CameraXSize : 512 CameraYSize : 512 CanAbortExposure : False CanAsymmetricBin : True CanGetCoolerPower : False CanPulseGuide : False CanSetCCDTemperature : True CanStopExposure : False Connected : False CoolerOn : CoolerPower : Description : ASCOM CCD camera simulator ElectronsPerADU : 0 FullWellCapacity : 300000 HasShutter : True HeatSinkTemperature : -4.6 ImageArray : ImageArrayVariant : ImageReady : IsPulseGuiding : LastError : LastExposureDuration : 0 LastExposureStartTime : MaxADU : 65535 MaxBinX : 4 MaxBinY : 4 NumX : 0 NumY : PixelSizeX : 24 PixelSizeY : 24 SetCCDTemperature : StartX : StartY :

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new ASCOM Dome driver object
The New-Dome cmdlet returns an ASCOM Dome driver as defined by the DeviceId parameter. The DriverId string is the internal driver identifier as returned by the ASCOM Chooser dialog.
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
Returns an ASCOM Dome driver object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new dome simulator driver and assigns it to the $dome variable

> $id = Show-Chooser "Dome" > $dome = New-Dome $id > $dome
Altitude : AtHome : AtPark : Azimuth : CanFindHome : True CanPark : True CanSetAltitude : True CanSetAzimuth : True CanSetPark : True CanSetShutter : True CanSlave : False CanSyncAzimuth : True Connected : False Description : ASCOM Dome Simulator DriverInfo : ASCOM Dome Simulator 5.0.6 Developed by Jon Brewster http://ascom-standards.org/ InterfaceVersion : 1 Name : I_Simulator ShutterStatus : Slaved : False Slewing :

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new NOVASCOM.Earth object
The New-Earth cmdlet returns an NOVASCOM.Earth object. The optional tjd parameter initializes the object for the specified terrestrial Julian date.
Optional initialization parameter, if supplied the Earth object will be initialized to the supplied terrestrial Julian date.
Optional initialization parameter, if supplied the Earth object will be initialized to the supplied terrestrial Julian date.
Returns a .NOVASCOM.Earth object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets $earth to an uninitialized NOVASCOM.Earth object

PS C:\> $earth = New-Earth PS C:\> $earth
BarycentricPosition : ASCOM.Astrometry.NOVASCOM.PositionVector BarycentricTime : 0 BarycentricVelocity : ASCOM.Astrometry.NOVASCOM.VelocityVector EarthEphemeris : ASCOM.Astrometry.Kepler.Ephemeris EquationOfEquinoxes : 0 HeliocentricPosition : ASCOM.Astrometry.NOVASCOM.PositionVector HeliocentricVelocity : ASCOM.Astrometry.NOVASCOM.VelocityVector MeanObliquity : 0 NutationInLongitude : 0 NutationInObliquity : 0 TrueObliquity : 0
Sets the $earth variable to a NOVASCOM.Earth object initialized to the supplied terrestrial Julian date.

PS C:\> $earth = New-Earth -tjd 2345676.234 PS C:\> $earth
BarycentricPosition : ASCOM.Astrometry.NOVASCOM.PositionVector BarycentricTime : 2345676.23400002 BarycentricVelocity : ASCOM.Astrometry.NOVASCOM.VelocityVector EarthEphemeris : ASCOM.Astrometry.Kepler.Ephemeris EquationOfEquinoxes : 0.566952144631457 HeliocentricPosition : ASCOM.Astrometry.NOVASCOM.PositionVector HeliocentricVelocity : ASCOM.Astrometry.NOVASCOM.VelocityVector MeanObliquity : 23.4769704224813 NutationInLongitude : 9.27324324161013 NutationInObliquity : 8.23532594355057 TrueObliquity : 23.4792580130212
Sets the $earth variable to a NOVASCOM.Earth object initialized to the supplied terrestrial Julian date. The optional -tjd parameter name is not specified.

PS C:\> $earth = New-Earth 2345676.234 PS C:\> $earth
BarycentricPosition : ASCOM.Astrometry.NOVASCOM.PositionVector BarycentricTime : 2345676.23400002 BarycentricVelocity : ASCOM.Astrometry.NOVASCOM.VelocityVector EarthEphemeris : ASCOM.Astrometry.Kepler.Ephemeris EquationOfEquinoxes : 0.566952144631457 HeliocentricPosition : ASCOM.Astrometry.NOVASCOM.PositionVector HeliocentricVelocity : ASCOM.Astrometry.NOVASCOM.VelocityVector MeanObliquity : 23.4769704224813 NutationInLongitude : 9.27324324161013 NutationInObliquity : 8.23532594355057 TrueObliquity : 23.4792580130212

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new ASCOM FilterWheel driver object
The New-FilterWheel cmdlet returns an ASCOM FilterWheel driver as defined by the DeviceId parameter. The DriverId string is the internal driver identifier as returned by the ASCOM Chooser dialog.
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
Returns an ASCOM FilterWheel driver object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new instance of the FilterWheel driver specified in $id and assigns it to the $fw variable.

PS C:\> $id = Show-Chooser "FilterWheel" PS C:\> $fw = New-FilterWheel $id PS C:\> $fw
Connected FocusOffsets Names Position --------- ------------ ----- -------- False {9345, 2587, 4541, 2357...} {Red, Green, Blue, Clear...}

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new ASCOM Focuser driver object
The New-Focuser cmdlet returns an ASCOM Focuser driver as defined by the DeviceId parameter. The DriverId string is the internal driver identifier as returned by the ASCOM Chooser dialog.
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
Returns an ASCOM Focuser driver object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Creates a new instance of the focuser driver specified in $id and assigns it to the $focuser variable.

PS C:\> $id = Show-Chooser "Focuser" PS C:\> $focuser = New-Focuser $id PS C:\> $focuser
Absolute : True IsMoving : Link : False MaxIncrement : 50000 MaxStep : 50000 Position : StepSize : 20 TempComp : TempCompAvailable : True Temperature :

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new ASCOM.Astrometry.Kelper object
Creates a new ASCOM.Astrometry.Kelper object
A ASCOM.Astrometry.Kelper object

dev:remarks.maml:para: Assigns an uninitialized ASCOM.Astrometry.Kepler object to the $kelper variable

PS C:\> $kepler = New-Kepler PS C:\> $kepler
a : 0 BodyType : e : 0 Epoch : 0 G : H : Incl : 0 M : 0 n : 0 Name : Node : 0 Number : P : Peri : 0 q : 0 z : Infinity

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new ASCOM Rotator driver object
The New-Rotator cmdlet returns an ASCOM Rotator driver as defined by the DeviceId parameter. The DriverId string is the internal driver identifier as returned by the ASCOM Chooser dialog.
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
Returns an ASCOM Rotator driver object.
Creates an ASCOM Switch driver object
The New-Telescope cmdlet returns an ASCOM Switch driver as defined by the DeviceId parameter. The DriverId string is the internal driver identifier as returned by the ASCOM Chooser dialog.
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
Returns an ASCOM Switch driver object.
Creates a new ASCOM Telescope driver object
The New-Telescope cmdlet returns an ASCOM Telescope driver as defined by the DeviceId parameter. The DriverId string is the internal driver identifier as returned by the ASCOM Chooser dialog.
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
A string representing the ASCOM drivers internal id, as returned by Show-Chooser
Returns an ASCOM Telescope driver object.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Demonstrates using the Show-Chooser cmdlet to obtain a driver id, then using New-Telescope to open the driver.

> $scope
AlignmentMode : algPolar Altitude : ApertureArea : 0.0269 ApertureDiameter : 0.2 AtHome : AtPark : Azimuth : CanFindHome : True CanPark : True CanPulseGuide : True CanSetDeclinationRate : True CanSetGuideRates : True CanSetPark : True CanSetPierSide : False CanSetRightAscensionRate : True CanSetTracking : True CanSlew : True CanSlewAltAz : True CanSlewAltAzAsync : True CanSlewAsync : True CanSync : True CanSyncAltAz : True CanUnpark : True Connected : False Declination : DeclinationRate : 0 Description : Software Telescope Simulator for ASCOM Copyright © 2001-2002, SPACE.com DoesRefraction : DriverInfo : ASCOM Telescope Simulator 5.0.9 Developed by Robert B. Denny, DC-3 Dreams, SP Copyright © 2001, SPACE.com Canada, Ltd. http://ascom-standards.org/ http://www.starrynight.com/ DriverVersion : 5.0 EquatorialSystem : equLocalTopocentric FocalLength : 1.26 GuideRateDeclination : GuideRateRightAscension : InterfaceVersion : 2 IsPulseGuiding : Name : I_Simulator RightAscension : RightAscensionRate : 0 SideOfPier : SiderealTime : 15.3078102816513 SiteElevation : 432.591736316681 SiteLatitude : 59.6314787864685 SiteLongitude : 15.3904178738594 SlewSettleTime : 0 Slewing : TargetDeclination : TargetRightAscension : Tracking : TrackingRate : driveSidereal TrackingRates : UTCDate : 04/07/2010 19:26:06

maml:description.maml:para: Creates a new ASCOM Util object

Returns an ASCOM Util object, it offers the following functions Util.DegreesToDM() Util.DegreesToDMS() Util.DegreesToHM() Util.DegreesToHMS() Util.DMSToDegrees() Util.FormatVar() Util.HMSToDegrees() Util.HMSToHours() Util.HoursToHM() Util.HoursToHMS() Util.LoadDLL() Util.LTrimString() Util.MessageBox() Util.RTrimString() Util.TrimString() Util.WaitForMilliseconds() Util.Yield()
An ASCOM Util object, performs some useful general purpose functions.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Returns an ASCOM Util object, see the ASCOM documentation for a full explanation of the capabilies.
> $util PlatformVersion : 5.5 SerialTraceFile : C:\SerialTrace.txt SerialTrace : False TimeZoneName : GMT Daylight Time TimeZoneOffset : -1 UTCDate : 04/07/2010 18:31:28 JulianDate : 2455382.27185955

maml:description.maml:para: Display the ASCOM Chooser dialog.
Display the ASCOM Chooser dialog.

If specified, the DeviceType parameter forces the Chooser dialog to only display installed drivers corresponding to that type. By default if no DeviceType is specified then only Telescope drivers are displayed.

If you supply a DriverID, the corresponding driver will be pre-selected in the Chooser's list when the Chooser window is first opened. The parameter is optional, and if omitted or passed "", no driver will be pre-selected in the Chooser window.

If specified, the DeviceType parameter forces the Chooser dialog to only display installed drivers corresponding to that type. By default if no DeviceType is specified then only Telescope drivers are displayed.

If you supply a DriverID, the corresponding driver will be pre-selected in the Chooser's list when the Chooser window is first opened. The parameter is optional, and if omitted or passed "", no driver will be pre-selected in the Chooser window.
A string representing the selected device drivers internal name.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Displays the Chooser for the default Telescope drivers
Simulator.Telescope
Shows the Chooser with Dome drivers in the selection list
Simulator.Dome
Shows the Chooser with the default Telescope drivers listed, the Simulator driver will be pre-selected in the list.
Simulator.Telescope
